newsitem.title: POLAND: Poles determined to join EU, split on pace - poll.
newsitem.headline: Poles determined to join EU, split on pace - poll.

text.p: More than 80 percent of Poles want Poland to enter the European Union but are divided on how fast the country should move towards membership, a survey by public polling agency OBOP showed on Friday.

According to the survey published in daily newspaper Gazeta Wyborcza a total of 82 percent supported EU membership, with 31 percent of those surveyed saying Poland should join as quickly as possible and 51 percent in favour of a more "go-slow" approach.
OBOP, controlled by public television, said only six percent opposed Poland's integration with the EU, while the remaining 12 percent said they had no opinion.

One third of those polled expected EU entry to have more good than negative effects, while 35 percent saw positive and negative effects balancing out and 12 percent feared EU membership would have more negative effects.
Wyborcza did not give comparative results of earlier surveys.
